intro: Pterocaulon alopecuroides var. mollis, commonly known as the soft-haired pterocaulon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish in color. The plant is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is a perennial shrub that often grows in coastal or arid environments. Its botanical features make it well adapted to withstand drought and salt spray.
